channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4592] CH-Fr // registration not possible - zip code validation
item.description: Due to a bug in the zip-code validation it is not possible to create new accounts at the moment in CH-fr. Please investigate what is the problem there.
item.summary: CH-Fr // registration not possible - zip code validation

comments.comment: fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4508] Order history shows no orders
item.description:
Until Friday order history was working properly. Today no orders are returned from my customer.
Could you please check? From our side the orders are retrieved.

Request:

<n0:OrderSearchRequest xmlns:n0="http://www.distrelec.com/sap">
<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
<customerId>1240903</customerId>
<filterOrderId></filterOrderId>
<filterInvoiceId></filterInvoiceId>
<filterCurrencyCode></filterCurrencyCode>
<filterOrderTotalMin></filterOrderTotalMin>
<filterOrderTotalMax></filterOrderTotalMax>
<filterOrderDateStart></filterOrderDateStart>
<filterOrderDateEnd></filterOrderDateEnd>
<filterOrderStatus></filterOrderStatus>
<sortCriteria></sortCriteria>
<sortAscending></sortAscending>
<resultSize></resultSize>
<resultOffset></resultOffset>
</n0:OrderSearchRequest>

Response:

  • <nm:OrderSearchResponse xmlns:nm="http://www.distrelec.com/sap" xmlns:prx="urn:sap.com:proxy:Q10:/1SAI/TASDA361F4301A8638A0C7D:731">
    <customerId>1240903</customerId>
  • <orders>
    <orderId>1000001028</orderId>
    <orderDate>20140701</orderDate>
    <orderStatus>01</orderStatus>
    <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
    <orderTotal>309.4</orderTotal>
    </orders>
  • <orders>
    <orderId>1000001116</orderId>
    <orderDate>20140702</orderDate>
    <orderStatus>01</orderStatus>
    <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
    <orderTotal>471.24</orderTotal>
    </orders>
  • <orders>
    <orderId>1000001089</orderId>
    <orderDate>20140702</orderDate>
    <orderStatus>02</orderStatus>
    <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
    <orderTotal>345.29</orderTotal>
    </orders>
    + <orders>
    <orderId>1000001101</orderId>
    <orderDate>20140702</orderDate>
    <orderStatus>02</orderStatus>
    <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
    <orderTotal>322.18</orderTotal>
    </orders>
  • <orders>
    <orderId>1000001103</orderId>
    <orderDate>20140702</orderDate>
    <orderStatus />
    <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
    <orderTotal>388.46</orderTotal>
    </orders>
    <resultTotalSize>5</resultTotalSize>
    </nm:OrderSearchResponse>

comments.comment: issue fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4579] Unknow error by picture upload
item.description:
Following message was displayed by trying to exchange a picture of a teaser content component DistCarpetContentTeaser in the IT carpet.
Das Element konnte aufgrund der folgenden Fehler nicht gespeichert werden: [com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.interceptor.DistCarpetContentTeaserValidateInterceptor@3f4d7576]:Das kleine Bild ist zwingend

Small picture were correctly uploaded. See screenshot. Please investigate.

comments.comment: @Florian: Please test the fix when it is released to Q

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4556] DE Order History doens't display the discounts
item.description:
If an order contains some discounts, these are not displayed in the order history deatil page.

Here a customer and order to test in Q system for germany (7350):

Customer: 0001237086
OrderID: 1000001439
item.summary: DE Order History doens't display the discounts

comments.comment: fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4543] DE, SE Testing // Myaccount - cannot change email
item.description: The email address cannot be changed in myaccount. Please check, thanks.
item.summary: DE, SE Testing // Myaccount - cannot change email

comments.comment: Please check, thanks.

as far as i know the email cannot be changed.
Am i wrong?
I'm afraid you are: The email address is supposed to be changeable (at least per shop spec - and I don't know of any restriction on this from SAP)
problem fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4533] HMC: Add search attribute "sales organization" to RMA section
item.description:
Could you please add the search attribut "sales organization" to the RMA section in the HMC.
Our RMA departments should be able to search country specific RMA requests.
item.summary: HMC: Add search attribute "sales organization" to RMA section

comments.comment:
Hi,

In the current version, the RMA (Movex) does not have a link to any sales organization and it is linked only to the customer. Should we add an additional relationship between the RMA objects and the sales org?
I added the attribute salesOrgCode to the MovexReturnRequest model. Then it will be possible to search for RMA objects by the sales Org code.
Now the HMC look like this (c.f. screenshot). So to find RMA request for a specific sales Org, we need just to filter by the sales org code.
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4506] Stock level clean-up job
item.description:
The distCleanUpStockCronJob cronjob does not automatically delete stock level entries having a certain age. Instead it honors a fix date defined at the cronjob. Nobody is the adapting the deleteItemsOlderThan date.

SELECT {PK} FROM {StockLevel} WHERE {lastModifiedErp} < ?deleteItemsOlderThan

CR: Delete old stock level entries after 7 days.

comments.comment: Fixed. Please test.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4491] False display
item.description: If I type in the search field "usb" then the following happens. See printscreen

comments.comment:
the problem is caused by a wrong IF-04 (sale status) batch file that we've received from SAP.
Evangelos said that the problem has been already fixed in DEV and we're waiting for the transport in Q system and then we'll receive the new right file to import in the platform

Now the correct data has been imported from SAP into hybris.
Now I think we need to perform an export to fact finder, since these data are provided by FF during the search suggestion call.
Problem seems to be resolved, please re-test.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4392] All Shops // Zoom Out in several browsers (5th cathegory dissapears)
item.description:
Zoom Out in Google Chrome does not work between 95% to 50%

please see the print screens
item.summary: All Shops // Zoom Out in several browsers (5th cathegory dissapears)

comments.comment: Seems to affect english in chrome, FF seems ok.

With the current implementation not much can be changed here. The navigation would have to be refactored, a viable option would be to convert it to a table. Effort about 0.5 - 1d.

There is a similar ticket about the cart: DISTRELEC-4165

As per Florian, prioritizing this one the same for Ruben.

Possible Solution would be done with display:table Properties and would fix the actual Problem of falling to the next line..Still the textlength of all navi points would be somewhat limited and if too long would fall to a second line.
With the next line we would have a problem with the Mega Fly Out right?

Please see the attached screenshots. With the new solution, if the text gets too long or the zoom level too high, it will just break each navi point into two lines. But such text lengths or zoom levels are not realistic anyway. (And the problem with the restricted possible text length is not new..)

so summarized, the proposed solution solves the problem with the 5th point falling to the next line, but it will not solve the (not new) fact, that there is only space for a certain length of text. And the megaflyout will still work.

I agree.
Most important thing is we don't have any missing navigation points.
does that mean, that I can implement it like suggested?
yes, please implement
done, can be tested on branch v2.0 after next deployment

attachment.name: distrelec main nav solution mega flyout.png
attachment.author: jawidmer

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4306] IF-15 Search Order: sort and order function has no effect in the result
item.description:
Hi Evangelos
the sorting functionality has no effect during the order search.
Also the sortAscending has no effect.
item.summary: IF-15 Search Order: sort and order function has no effect in the result

comments.comment:
Hello Francesco,
Sap do not recognize the date you are sending. Could you please send in the sort criteria
VBELN for order number
ERDAT for date
and WAERK for currency?

Hi Evangelos,
we can use these values, but the sorting fields should be:
CREATIONDATE, TOTAL, STATUS

Let us know the sort code for each value.

Hello Ligia,
Could you please modify accordingly thi interface? Can we include also the status?

Hi Evangelos,

I implemented the new logic for sort.
The sort codes are the followings:

  • CURRENCY_CODE - for currency
  • ORDER_STATUS - for status
  • ORDER_DATE - for creation date
  • ORDER_TOTAL - for total

Please test in D01 and let me know your test result.

Best Regards,
Ligia

Hi Neeraj
could you please test this?

Thank you
Hi Neeraj, did you already test this?

I updated the soap request to set the correct values for sorting criteria:

  • ORDER_STATUS : to sort by status
  • ORDER_DATE : to sort by date
  • ORDER_TOTAL: to sort by total price

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4155] LT - sort on price in order history not correct
item.description:
Windows 7 Professional, Service Pack 1
IE 11.0.9600.17041
TS-24.03

Log in: distrelec.testing+lt2@gmail.com, pw: distrelec. Go to order history, sort is not working, the orders are always sorted on date ascending. (img_102/103_lt_pzu)
item.summary: LT - sort on price in order history not correct

comments.comment:
It seems that the problem come from SAP, it always sort by date.

==> Tested using SOAP-UI

Ticket is similar to DISTRELEC-4306 that I have asked Francesco for the following:

Sap do not recognize the date you are sending. Could you please send in the sort criteria
VBELN for order number
ERDAT for date
and WAERK for currency?
I updated the sort criteria as mentioned in the ticket DISTRELEC-4306. However, this will not resolve the problem completely because there is also a problem in SAP side.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3913] Wrong linked product in the manufacturer search result list
item.description:
please check this out:

  • Write „velleman“ into searchbar
  • Change to Hersteller in the flyout and click on “Velleman”
  • Search result page will be displayed
  • Click the product at third position(“Radioaktivitätsüberwachung”)
  • Detail page for “LED-Kerze in satiniertem Kunststoffbehälter, XMCL18, Velleman“ appears
item.summary: Wrong linked product in the manufacturer search result list

comments.comment:
Seems to be a data and factfinder related problem:

The product part of the link from the manufacturer page is ok:

http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Blinkender-Weihnachtsbaum-Bausatz-Velleman-MK142/p/18500241

But when used with the factfinder related query data it forwards to a different product:

http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Blinkender-Weihnachtsbaum-Bausatz-Velleman-MK142/p/18500241?q=*&filter_Manufacturer=Velleman&page=2&origPos=115&origPageSize=10&simi=100.0

I couldn't reproduce this behavior on the test system.
So it will be a bit trickie to debug.

The Manufacturer-Search does work differently than the normal search (e.g. the not buyable products will be shown or the query will only be applied on the manufacturer field).

For the product forward-and-back-buttons an additional logic with another search is applied, which can cause a forward to another product, if there is another result.
As this search is a normal search there are lots of different results (especially if the search list has not buyable products). Also the relevance sort mode has many wrong links as the product order is different.

• Added a URL-Parameter for Manufacturer Search (manufacturerCode)
  • if the manufacturer code on a SearchQueryData is set, always a manufacturer search will be executed (searchField is only manufacturer)
  • the new Parameter will be computed and added to the product url while generating the product models
  • the new Parameter will also be computed for the next- and previous links
code is currently checked in in Branch v2.0

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3830] Different drop shippment stock for ITA
item.description:
The stock of drop shippment items for Italy should be different to Switzerland/Austria.
For that reason we need a specific ITA-stock import for local drop shippment "Streckenartikel" products.

We only will get this file (erp_stock-D3P273)once a day.
item.summary: Different drop shippment stock for ITA

comments.comment: Define Warehouse with Raphael Leu.

The Warehouses should be named:
-EFIT
-ESIT
Further clarification needed, Florian will update with results and next steps, if needed.

Please implement as discussed.
Priorization Logic.

I’ve done some tests, in attached the results.

Most (not all) the Ingram Micro ITA and Esprinet availabilities are correct, all the Tech Data ITA are wrong.

So it seems that there is for all of the 3 Italian supplier something to fix.
Attached the updated test results

Although there is a StockLevel=0 for the exclusive warehouse ESIT, the shop displays the StockLevel for EF11 (which is 196).
Desired availability is 0 since the exclusive warehouse has no stock. (see screenshot1.png)

Wrong availability displayed in the following case: Site (e.g. IT) has an exclusiveFast and an exclusiveSlow warehouse. There is NO StockLevel for exclusiveFast but normalFast and there is also a StockLevel for the exclusiveSlow warehouse.
=> calculation returned an availability for normalFast although there in an exclusiveSlow!

Fixed. Please test.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3679] Elfa 180 Open Order: New Open_Order_Detail Page (ELFA_P420) BE
item.description:
Elfa 180 Open Order: New Open_Order_Detail Page (ELFA_P420) BE

https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/ELFA_P420-Open_Order_Detail
item.summary: Elfa 180 Open Order: New Open_Order_Detail Page (ELFA_P420) BE

comments.comment:
Hi Francesco,

I created the following jsp Page file for the Open Order Detail Page: accountOpenOrderDetailsPage.jsp

On This Page, I need the following

Variables:

  • openOrderClosingDates (List of possible Dates for this Order)
  • openOrderStartDate (Date when the open order was created originally)
  • openOrderSelectedClosingDate (String / Date, which Date was selected)
  • openOrderAllUsersCanEdit (Boolean, if the Option "All users can Edit Open Order" was set)
  • openOrderReference (String, Order Reference added by the user during checkout)
  • openOrderCloseLink (Link to close the open order, after calling this link, a global Message should appear according to the concept and the user should be redirected to the order history page)

Ajax Calls (Since there is no Save Button, I will need to send a call for every change made by the user)

  • Call to set the OpenOrderClosingDate
  • Call to set the "All users can Edit" Option (Only if the current user is an admin or the creator of the open order, he can edit this option)
  • Call to set the order Reference

Based on these calls you should be able to add the above variables to the model and return them on pageload

Hi Jan,

Please find the variable names as following :-

openOrderClosingDates
orderDate
openOrderSelectedClosingDate
openOrdereditableForAllContacts
openOrderReference
openOrderCloseLink

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3673] Missing Promotion Labels
item.description:
Some promotion labels are missing on the searchresult list.
e.g. item 776503 is marked with an "Angebot" label on the detailpage but not on the searchresult list.

"New" labels are available:
http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=tft

comments.comment: what's the status here?
This might be a back end problem. Investigating...
Any results?

Hi Erik
Could you please give a status for this?

It seems the field "product.activePromotionLabels" isn't populated correctly when used in /distrelecB2Bstorefront/web/webroot/WEB-INF/terrific/modules/product/product.jsp. The front end code currently allows a maximum of one label (probably a design decision), but "Offer" label isn't displayed. I've tried to backtrack the code, but it got a bit over my head. It might be that /distrelecB2Bfacades/src/com/namics/distrelec/b2b/facades/search/converter/populator/SearchResultPromotionLabelPopulator.java is a good starting point to look.
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3213] Facet Search Improvement: Selection of facets with one result should not jump to detail page
item.description:
Current behavior:

  • if the user selects a facet for which there is exactly one result, the detail page of the resulting product is opened directly.
  • Example: select "1.5 mOhm" on http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=widerstand
  • This is cumbersome, because most often the user would like to select a number of facets, but after the first one he already force-left the search page.
  • (however this behavior is well intended and appreciated when an actual keyword search only returns one single product)

Improvement:

  • Leave the behavior as it is for the keyword search, BUT
  • Don't open the detail page if only one result remains after a facet was applied. Instead show the result list with only the one remaining result.
item.summary: Facet Search Improvement: Selection of facets with one result should not jump to detail page

comments.comment:
Is mostly backend work, because the backend needs to adjust the url.

Frontend Work maybe 0.25 days.

Raphael,
can you please do a BE estimate for this change?
Could you please estimate the effort? thx
When ticket DISTRELEC-3212 is done, there is no more frontend work to be done to make this feature work.
Nabil, please approach Raphael if you need help.
fixed

Nabil,
due to the delay of the elfa releases, this fix (being checked in to trunk) will now take too long before it goes live.

Can you please also apply the fix to the 2.0 branch?

Thanks!
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4357] R3 Feature: Bestseller Label
item.description:
Requirement

  • Initial Situation:
    • Bestseller info not available from movex, hence feature was not built
  • Requirement:
    • Receive info on bestseller products from SAP
    • Display respective promo label accordingly
  • Stakeholder:
    • Original webshop requirement
  • Discussion Points:
    • IF ready for this?
    • Spec needed?

IF description: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/IF-52+Bestseller+Status
Specification:

  • https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/G121+Promotion+Labels
  • https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/C28-ProductLabel

Next Steps
Specification
Estimate (initial provisional estimate of 0.5d added, may change)
Planning
Implementation

comments.comment:
As per Evangelos: feature has been developed in SAP side.
Needs implementation of DISTRELEC-2578 IF-52

Hi Nando,

Where can I find IF-52 if it is ready ?
I tried to take an update of wsdl for existing interface but I didn't find IF-52 over there so is it going to be a new wsdl/ end point for IF-52.
If yes, then please let me know the new end point, so that I can test this IF and start implementing these interfaces.

thanks

Hi Nando,

Could you please check with Evangelos , if IF-52 is ready on both PI & ERP ?

Thanks
Evangelos, could you please answer the question of Neeraj?

Hello Maciel,
Could you please let us know if IF-52 is developed from your side?
Yes, PI is ready.

Hi Maciej,

I took an updated wsdl from D pi system and did found the IF-52 there
Are you sure that you have published the latest wsdl from PI ?

Thanks

Hello Maciej,
Could you please check the last comment?

hi,

IF-52 was developed as asynchronous interfaces, hence it is not present in WSDL.
It works as other asynchronous interfaces: IF-01 to IF-05.
Thanks I got your point.
Ready for testing

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4516] Amendment of CustomerID
item.description:
This is referring to the initial Webtrekk-Spec (compare chapter 7.7).

  • Current implementation: If a user is not logged in, a standard-value of 'b87bc7e8f6520339fecdbabf48a51c3f' is transmitted via the Webtrekk-pixel (compare attached screenshot).
  • Required implementation: If no log-in has taken place, a zero-value ('0’) is to be transmitted.

Thx Mark

comments.comment: fixed
